installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# File: Pterodactyl 7 Days 2 Die
# Authors: gOOvER
# Date: 2024/03/30
# License: MIT License

clear
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m'

echo -e "${BLUE}-------------------------------------------------${NC}"
echo -e "${YELLOW}7 Days 2 Die Installscript${NC}"
echo -e "${YELLOW}Egg by gOOvER | https://gameserver.tech${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}-------------------------------------------------${NC}"

#apt -y update
#apt -y --no-install-recommends install curl lib32gcc-s1 ca-certificates jq dos2unix

echo -e "${BLUE}-------------------------------------------------${NC}"
echo -e "${YELLOW}download and install steamcmd. please wait...${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}-------------------------------------------------${NC}"

## just in case someone removed the defaults.
if [[ "${STEAM_USER}" == "" ]] || [[ "${STEAM_PASS}" == "" ]]; then
    echo -e "steam user is not set.\n"
    echo -e "Using anonymous user.\n"
    STEAM_USER=anonymous
    STEAM_PASS=""
    STEAM_AUTH=""
else
    echo -e "user set to ${STEAM_USER}"
fi

## download and install steamcmd
cd /tmp
mkdir -p /mnt/server/steamcmd
curl -sSL -o steamcmd.tar.gz https://steamcdn-a.akamaihd.net/client/installer/steamcmd_linux.tar.gz
tar -xzvf steamcmd.tar.gz -C /mnt/server/steamcmd
mkdir -p /mnt/server/steamapps # Fix steamcmd disk write error when this folder is missing
cd /mnt/server/steamcmd

# SteamCMD fails otherwise for some reason, even running as root.
# This is changed at the end of the install process anyways.
chown -R root:root /mnt
export HOME=/mnt/server
echo -e "${GREEN}..done..${NC}"

## install game using steamcmd
echo -e "${BLUE}-------------------------------------------------${NC}"
echo -e "${YELLOW}install game using steamcmd. please wait...${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}-------------------------------------------------${NC}"

./steamcmd.sh +force_install_dir /mnt/server +login ${STEAM_USER} ${STEAM_PASS} ${STEAM_AUTH} $( [[ "${WINDOWS_INSTALL}" == "1" ]] && printf %s '+@sSteamCmdForcePlatformType windows' ) $( [[ "${STEAM_SDK}" == "1" ]] && printf %s '+app_update 1007' ) +app_update ${SRCDS_APPID} $( [[ -z ${SRCDS_BETAID} ]] || printf %s "-beta ${SRCDS_BETAID}" ) $( [[ -z ${SRCDS_BETAPASS} ]] || printf %s "-betapassword ${SRCDS_BETAPASS}" ) ${INSTALL_FLAGS} validate +quit
echo -e "${GREEN}..done..${NC}"

## set up 32 bit libraries
mkdir -p /mnt/server/.steam/sdk32
cp -v linux32/steamclient.so ../.steam/sdk32/steamclient.so

## set up 64 bit libraries
mkdir -p /mnt/server/.steam/sdk64
cp -v linux64/steamclient.so ../.steam/sdk64/steamclient.so

## add below your custom commands if needed
mkdir -p /home/container/UserDataFolder

## install end
echo -e "${BLUE}-------------------------------------------------${NC}"
echo -e "${GREEN}Installation completed...${NC}"
echo -e "${BLUE}-------------------------------------------------${NC}"

variables.name: [SERVER] Language
variables.description: rimary language for players on this server. Values: Use any language name that you would users expect to search for. Should be the English name of the language, e.g. not "Deutsch" but "German"

variables.name: [SERVER] Network Protocols
variables.description: Networking protocols that should NOT be used. Separated by comma. Possible values: LiteNetLib, SteamNetworking. Dedicated servers should disable SteamNetworking if there is no NAT router in between your users and the server or when port-forwarding is set up correctly. lets it empty if you are connecting your self hosted server behind a NAT

variables.name: [SERVER] Auto Update
variables.description:
This is to auto update the server on start.

Options are 0 or 1
Default is 1

variables.name: [GAMEWORLD] GameWorld
variables.description: "RWG" (see WorldGenSeed and WorldGenSize options below) or any already existing world name in the Worlds folder (currently shipping with e.g. "Navezgane", "PREGEN01", ...)

variables.name: [GAMEWORLD] GameName
variables.description: Whatever you want the game name to be. This affects the save game name as well as the seed used when placing decoration (trees etc) in the world. It does not control the generic layout of the world if creating an RWG world

variables.name: [GAMEWORLD] WorldGenSeed
variables.description: If RWG this is the seed for the generation of the new world. If a world with the resulting name already exists it will simply load it

variables.name: [GAMEWORLD] WorldGenSize
variables.description: If RWG this controls the width and height of the created world. It is also used in combination with WorldGenSeed to create the internal RWG seed thus also creating a unique map name even if using the same WorldGenSeed. Has to be between 2048 and 16384, though large map sizes will take long to generate / download / load

variables.name: [TELNET] Password
variables.description: Telnet listens on a local interface by default without a password. However, you can specify a password if  you wish to expose telnet.

variables.name: [SERVER] ServerWebsiteURL
variables.description: Website URL for the server, will be shown in the serverbrowser as a clickable link

variables.name: [STEAM] Beta Branch
variables.description: Installs beta branch if specified. For example, latest_experimental would install the latest experimental branch release. Requires a reinstall to switch branches properly.

variables.name: [SYSTEM] LD_LIBRARY_PATH
variables.description: This is really annoying that more games are doing this.

variables.name: [STEAM] Steam AppID
variables.description: This is the app id for 7dtd please no step on snek.
